commitResults.messageBody:
Added greeting function for greeting user when starting the program.
Updated Duke to JAV

Added exit function for say farewell to user when exiting the program.
Updated some text to be more reflective of the personality

Added Echo function to echo any message
Updated the printing format
Fixed some commenting

Added Storage class for storage needs
Added MessagePrinter class for message needs
Split functionality to classes so no more god class
Updated comments

Added functionality to mark and unmark
Added Task class
Modified Storage and MessagePrinter to work with Task class
More update to comments
Modified README to reflect additions

commitResults.messageTitle: Added 3 types of tasks; todo, event, deadline
commitResults.messageBody:
Added todo class
Added deadline class
Added event class
Adjusted main class for easier checking
Added enum for the different types of tasks

Modified input and expected txt with runtest batch file to semi-automate test for regression
Remove random tempCodeRunnerFile from vscode
Remove debugging text in event.java
Added exception handling

Added remove function
Updated readme
Adjusted test for remove function

Added FileManager class for file reading and writing
Added save functionality
Updated task subclasses for for reading and saving
Updated runtest.bat to delete savefile when testing

Updated README to include save
Added time feature to Deadline class
Updated testing
This reverts commit 75bb637a3f18cc7a50d8490ba3c52bceac20512d.

Updated README to include save
Added time feature to Deadline class
Updated testing

did an oppsie and didn't branch :(

commitResults.messageTitle: Adhering to coding standard + more OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Modified everything so they fit the coding standard, rip time
Made the code more OOP
-Already have Ui (MessagePrinter)
-Already have Storage (FileManager)
-Added Parser
-Already have TaskList (StorageManager)

Extracted commands into their separate own class
Converted managers to singleton
Put all classes in some package

Added gradle task testing
Some fixes for packaging.
Added Junit test class (just for testing, will be repurposing for later)

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for Deadlines and Events
commitResults.messageBody:
Add JUnit tests for Deadlines and Events to test the behavior of the respective classes.

There are cases where construction of a deadline or an event could result in a error due to the invalid parameters.

The addition of JUnit tests will allow for such bugs to be caught with greater ease.

Update gradle settings for shadowJar gradle plugin to package an application into an executable JAR file.

The plugin required certain settings in the build.gradle and the file directory in the fileManager class to be configured to be successful in building the JAR file.

Add JavaDoc to areas without it.

The goal is to add header comments to all non-private classes/methods, and non-trivial private methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to comply with coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Modify all present lines of code to comply with the given coding standard.

The goal is to tweak the code to comply with the given coding standard outlined here https://se-education.org/guides/conventions/java/index.html

Add new command child class - FindTaskCommand.

The goal is to give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword.

The implementation ensures the OOP structure through the parser-command system.

Adjust sections of the code that were previously not as clear, change the way toString() method is handled for all task related classes and replace usage of concatenation in FileManager to be StringBuilder instead.

The goal is to be clearer in comments and error messages, extract common toString() code so the subclasses have fewer sections of repeated code and be more efficient in FileManager with the use of StringBuilder.

Thanks to chiralcentre for the useful feedback!

Integrate Checkstyle to the project with Gradle and refactor code that contained violations.

The goal is to have a tool to automatically check the code for any coding standard violations.

Note that following config files and how it affects the checks:
config/checkstyle/checkstyle.xml: Rules to follow.
config/checkstyle/suppressions.xml: Rules to suppress under in which files.

Integrate basic GUI via JavaFX.

The goal is to use the JavaFX technology to implement the GUI and replace the previous text-based UI.

Guide found here: https://se-education.org/guides/tutorials/javaFx.html

Refactor all relevant UI code such as the responses to commands to properly reflect in the new GUI.

The goal is to make use of the previously implemented JavaFX technology and convert all of the existing text UI to the new GUI.

Improve code quality with addition of guard clauses and better naming.

The goal is to maximize readability by avoiding deep nesting with arrowhead-like shapes and making the happy path more prominent with the addition of guard clauses.
Additionally there is some modification to the vague naming done regarding Booleans.

Address the issues highlighted to improve code quality.

The goal is to update and improve the code further based
on the feedback received by the soc-se-bot, addressing all
issues regarding Header Comments.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include assert to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Include Java's assert feature to document important
assumptions that should hold at various points in the code.

The goal is to use assertions to check and document
important assumptions about certain arguments.

Additionally, in the process of searching for locations to
include assertions. A location where assertion could be
used was found in the DeleteTaskCommand and
UpdateTaskMarkCommand classes but instead of using
assertions, using exception handling is determined to be
more suitable.
Include assert to document important assumptions

Implement two new classes to give the ability to undo the
most recent command.

The goal is to keep track of the commands done by the
user and allow undoing of successful commands. All
commands need to implement the undo method however
only certain commands are required to actually have some
functionality.

Also, some refactoring was done on the Task class and its
child classes to allow for easier undoing and the file system
is properly integrated with the current GUI (It was not
saving and loading after the GUI changes).

Finalize features, bug fix and add screenshot of Ui as Ui.png.

The goal is to finalize all feature, resolve the bug involving task marking not being saved to the file and prepare the program for the final version.

Update README.md to reflect the finalized product.

The goal is to ensure the chatbot name is stated clearly at the top of the User Guide and provide the reader with enough guidance to be able to use all important features of the chatbot.

Inclusion of descriptions regarding the Undo command and removal of depreciated information such as greetings and farewell.
